grph.algo.distance

Class PageRank

  • java.lang.Object
    • grph.algo.distance.PageRank

  • public class PageRank
extends java.lang.Object
    The page rank value for every vertex in the graph. The page rank is computed iteratively, by performing random walks from random sources.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PageRank(Grph g, java.util.Random prng)
      Creates an empty page rank for the given graph, using the given random number generator.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      Performs random walks of the given length, starting from every vertex in the graph.

      Computes the page rank value for every vertex in the graph.
      toools.math.Distribution<java.lang.Double> getDistribution()
      Computes the distribution for this page rank.
      int getNumberOfOccurences(int v)
      Retrieves the number of times the given vertex was encountered along the random walks
      double getRank(int v)
      Computes the rank for the given vertex.

      Performs the given number of random walks of the given length, starting from every vertex in the graph.
      void randomWalk(int source, int length)
      Performs one single random walk of the given length, starting from the given source.
      void render()
      Graphically renders this page rank on the graph.

      • PageRank

        public PageRank(Grph g,
                java.util.Random prng)
        Creates an empty page rank for the given graph, using the given random number generator.
        Parameters:
        g - a graph
        prng - a pseudo-random number generator

    • Method Detail

      • getNumberOfOccurences

        public int getNumberOfOccurences(int v)
        Retrieves the number of times the given vertex was encountered along the random walks
        Parameters:
        v -
        Returns:

      • getRank

        public double getRank(int v)
        Computes the rank for the given vertex.
        Parameters:
        v - a vertex in the graph
        Returns:
        the rank of v, which is a ratio between 0 and 1. The sum of the ranks for all vertices in the graph is 1.

      • render

        public void render()
        Graphically renders this page rank on the graph.

      • getDistribution

        public toools.math.Distribution<java.lang.Double> getDistribution()
        Computes the distribution for this page rank.
        Returns:
        the distribution object.

      • iterate

        public void iterate(int numberOfIterations,
                    int walksLength)
        Performs the given number of random walks of the given length, starting from every vertex in the graph.
        Parameters:
        numberOfIterations - the number of "all source random walks" to do.
        walksLength - the length of each random walk

      • allSourceRandomWalks

        public void allSourceRandomWalks(int walksLength,
                                 boolean multithreaded)
        Performs random walks of the given length, starting from every vertex in the graph.
        Parameters:
        walksLength - the length of each random walk
        multithreaded - whether the process will be be multi-threaded.

      • randomWalk

        public void randomWalk(int source,
                       int length)
        Performs one single random walk of the given length, starting from the given source.
        Parameters:
        source - a vertex in the graph
        length - the length of the walk.

      • compute

        public void compute()
        Computes the page rank value for every vertex in the graph. If the graph has less than 1000 vertices, this runs n "all source random walks" of length n (complexity is O(n2)), other this runs sqrt(n) "all source random walks" of length sqrt(n) (complexity is O(n)).
